courseDescription: An introduction to the chemical, physical and biological factors affecting human health and well-being. The emphasis is on application of controls to prevent disease and maximize environmental quality.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of health risks
Collaboration with interdisciplinary teams
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Project management for environmental health initiatives
Coordination of control measures for disease prevention

courseDescription: Advanced study of selected topics.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of environmental findings to stakeholders
Collaboration with interdisciplinary teams for environmental projects
Public speaking on environmental health issues
Writing technical reports for environmental research
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Risk assessment and mitigation strategies for environmental hazards
Data interpretation for environmental impact assessments
Identifying solutions for environmental sustainability challenges
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Project management for environmental research studies
Policy advocacy for environmental health initiatives
Conflict resolution in environmental decision-making processes

courseDescription: An introduction to the industrial environment relative to health problems and the etiologically related agents.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of health problems in the workplace
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with workers and management regarding health issues
Ability to convey complex information in a clear manner
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing health data to identify patterns and trends
Developing strategies to address occupational health hazards
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading occupational health initiatives within a workplace
Coordinating health and safety programs for employees

courseTitle: Environmental and Occupational Health Internship I
courseDescription: Includes placement in a health-related facility or industrial setting, prearranged with faculty instructor.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data collection and analysis in health settings
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with health professionals and industrial staff
Collaboration with multidisciplinary teams in health-related facilities
Presenting findings from environmental assessments to stakeholders
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying health risks in occupational environments
Developing strategies to mitigate environmental hazards
Interpreting data to make informed decisions in health and safety assessments
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating fieldwork schedules in health facilities or industrial sites
Leading a team in conducting health and safety inspections
Managing project timelines and deliverables during the internship

courseDescription: Includes placement in a health-related facility or industrial setting, prearranged with faculty instructor.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with health professionals and industrial personnel
Reporting findings to stakeholders
Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing complex data sets for trends and patterns

courseDescription: Includes placement in a health-related facility or industrial setting, prearranged with faculty instructor.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data collection and analysis in health-related settings
Knowledge of industrial health standards and regulations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with health professionals and industrial personnel
Collaboration with diverse teams in a professional setting
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying health-related risks in industrial environments
Developing strategies for mitigating health hazards in the workplace
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing health-related projects in a facility setting
Leading initiatives to improve environmental health practices in industrial settings

courseTitle: Principles of Occupational Safety and Health
courseDescription: A broad overview of the field of safety.  A study of the factors influencing the occurrence of accidents and incidents is set in the context of safety legislation, current issues in the practice of safety and the ethical and professional responsibilities of the safety practitioner.  The course also includes discussions of product safety, fire prevention and protection systems safety and human elements in loss prevention.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of safety procedures
Conflict resolution in safety incidents
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Team coordination in emergency response situations

courseTitle: Occupational Safety Standards, Laws and Regulations
courseDescription: A review of the important Occupational Safety and Health Standards and Codes with particular emphasis on application of these codes to typical work situations. Governmental enforcement methodologies are also discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of Occupational Safety and Health Standards
Application of codes to work situations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: N/A

courseDescription: An in-depth study of the communicable disease processes as they pertain to environmental sources.  A detailed discussion of specific communicable diseases that are manifested by various environmental etiologic agents.  Various environmental control measures to prevent the incidence of communicable diseases are presented.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding environmental sources of communicable diseases
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of disease processes
Collaboration with healthcare professionals for prevention strategies
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying specific communicable diseases based on environmental factors
Analyzing data on disease incidence and prevalence
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Developing strategies for prevention and control measures
Leading initiatives to combat communicable diseases

courseDescription: A comprehensive study of food and milk production, processing and preservation and controls exercised for the prevention of foodborne illnesses and spoilage.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of food safety protocols
Team collaboration in implementing safety measures
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification of potential foodborne illness risks
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading a team in maintaining food safety standards

courseDescription: Introduction to water quality management and wastewater treatment technology.  Topics include the effect of organic, inorganic and thermal pollutants in water quality streams, waterborne diseases, monitoring concepts, methods of water quality management, regulatory considerations, theory and application of wastewater treatment concepts, wastewater characterization, and treatment methods and disposal methods.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of water quality data
Collaboration with regulatory bodies for compliance

courseDescription: Vector-borne diseases affect the health and well-being of humans and other animals in a wide variety of ways.  Arthropod vectors (e.g., mosquitoes, filth flies, ticks and related groups) transmit numerous debilitating infectious diseases that oftentimes impose significant burden on healthcare systems. This course provides insight on the ways in which arthropods impact global health and economic growth through the diseases they transmit.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with public health agencies
Effective communication of disease risks to the community
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading interdisciplinary teams in disease control efforts

courseDescription: A study of the physical aspects of housing and institutions as they relate to human health and well-being.  Coverage is also given to infection control in health-care facilities.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of infection control in healthcare facilities
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with stakeholders in housing and institutions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of physical aspects impacting human health and well-being
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Ability to lead and manage infection control measures in healthcare facilities

courseTitle: Occupational Safety and Health Program Management
courseDescription: The establishment, implementation and maintenance of occupational safety and health programs.  Paradigms of safety, techniques for safety training and creation of value for safety among business managers and employees are emphasized.
Technical and Digital Skills: Creating value for safety in business operations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with business managers and employees regarding safety
Building consensus on safety practices
Training employees on safety protocols
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing strategies to address safety issues
Analyzing safety data for trends and patterns

courseDescription: An in-depth examination of the varied types of physical hazards in the work environment and the methods of prevention, recognition and control.
Technical and Digital Skills: Identification of physical hazards in the work environment
Implementation of control measures for physical hazards
Use of safety equipment and tools for hazard prevention
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of hazard recognition to team members
Collaboration with colleagues on hazard control strategies
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing the root causes of physical hazards
Developing innovative solutions for hazard prevention and control
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading safety training sessions on physical hazard prevention
Creating and implementing safety protocols for hazard recognition and control

courseDescription: This course uses a multi-disciplinary approach and draws on theory, case studies, research, and field experience to examine the global problem of environmental emergencies and disasters. Particular attention is devoted to the public health challenges posed by chemical and radiological contamination situations. Students discuss contemporary issues and controversies, and spend time working in teams to craft solutions to key emergency preparedness problems.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Team collaboration in crafting solutions
Effective communication in crisis situations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating public health challenges in disasters

courseDescription: An introduction to the terminology, concepts and applications of physiology, anthropometry, biomechanics and engineering to workplace and work methods design. Emphasis will be given to workplace design and work methods for job safety and health.
Technical and Digital Skills: Utilizing engineering principles in work methods design
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effectively communicating workplace design concepts
Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams for job safety and health initiatives
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing workplace ergonomics for safety improvements
Identifying ergonomic risk factors in work environments
Developing solutions for ergonomic challenges in the workplace
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading workplace design projects for job safety and health

courseDescription: An in-depth study of the chemical and physical agents responsible for occupational illness and the methods used for their measurement, evaluation and control.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of health risks to stakeholders
Collaboration with interdisciplinary teams for safety measures
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification of control measures for hazardous agents
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading safety training sessions for employees

courseDescription: An introduction to the detection and sampling alternatives used for estimating worker exposure to hazardous chemical, physical and biological agents in the occupational environment. Field and class activities are intended to simulate select occupational exposure situations and provide a basis for selection of the best evaluation techniques. Emphasis is on quantitative and qualitative methods typically used when estimating employee exposure to hazardous agents and the subjective decision making process.
Technical and Digital Skills: Sampling techniques for chemical, physical, and biological agents
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of sampling results
Collaboration in field and class activities
Presentation of exposure estimates to stakeholders
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Decision-making process for selecting evaluation techniques
Critical evaluation of employee exposure estimates
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing subjective decision-making in exposure estimation

courseDescription: An introduction to the fundamentals of toxicology with emphasis on the interaction of environmental and industrial chemicals with humans are studied.  Exposure, dose response, kinetics and distribution of toxicants, metabolism of toxic agents, factors that affect toxicity and introductory chemical carcinogenesis are discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of exposure, dose response, and kinetics of toxicants
Knowledge of metabolism of toxic agents
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Clear communication of toxicology concepts to non-experts
Collaboration with interdisciplinary teams for toxicology research

courseDescription: The study of air pollution in relation to air quality criteria, pollutant production, atmospheric evolution, measurement and control techniques.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborative research on air pollution
Effective communication of pollution data to stakeholders
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Implementing control measures based on analysis
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with regulatory agencies for compliance

courseDescription: Use and application of sampling methods and equipment for measurement of physical hazards in the work environment.  Includes aspects such as ergonomics, noise, vibration and radiation.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with team members on hazard assessment
Presenting findings from hazard measurements to stakeholders
Effective communication of safety recommendations based on measurements
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying potential risks based on measurements
Developing solutions to mitigate physical hazards in the work environment
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading a team in conducting hazard assessments
Delegating tasks effectively during hazard measurement activities

courseDescription: An introductory course in the principles and practices of epidemiology and the application of statistical and mathematical design and analysis of health research studies for the understanding and control of population health and disease with emphasis on environmental applications.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective presentation of research findings
Collaboration on research projects

courseDescription: Description of the hazardous waste problem, the fundamentals of the chemistry involved with hazardous waste transport, methods of identification, assessment, control, and disposal of toxic and hazardous waste are discussed. In addition the relevant legal statutes, risk assessment emergency response and case studies are presented.  Introduction to the toxicological effects of exposure to hazardous waste is discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Toxicological effects of exposure to hazardous waste
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of hazardous waste risks
Collaboration on hazardous waste management strategies
Presenting case studies on hazardous waste incidents
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of hazardous waste information
Risk assessment for hazardous waste disposal
Emergency response planning for hazardous waste incidents
Analyzing legal statutes related to hazardous waste management
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Implementing risk mitigation strategies for hazardous waste
Decision-making in hazardous waste disposal scenarios

courseDescription: The management of hazardous materials includes a wide array of interlocking regulations addressing use, manufacturing, exposure, storage, shipping and disposal.  A life cycle review of hazardous materials highlighting best practices and legislation is presented.  Useful in preparation for CHMM examination.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of storage and disposal practices for hazardous materials
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of hazardous materials information
Collaboration with regulatory agencies and stakeholders in hazardous materials management
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Development of strategies for safe handling and disposal of hazardous materials
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Implementation of best practices in hazardous materials management
Leading teams in the safe handling of hazardous materials

courseTitle: Environmental and Occupational Risk Assessment and Decision Analysis
courseDescription: The principles of quantitative health risk assessment of toxicants are presented.  Qualitative and quantitative skills necessary to evaluate the probability of injury, disease, or death in the general population from exposure to environmental and occupational contaminants are discussed.  Hazardous identification, exposure assessment, dose-response evaluation and risk characterization are emphasized.  Risk management group projects assessing some real environmental risks are an important segment of the class.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Group project collaboration
Presentation of risk assessments
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of toxicants' impact on population health

courseDescription: Course addresses day-to-day technical and management aspects of environmental compliance, as well as regulatory issues faced in industrial applications.  Includes audits and inspections, air and water pollution and  hazardous waste.
Technical and Digital Skills: Air and water pollution control techniques
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with regulatory bodies
Negotiation skills for compliance issues
Collaborating with internal teams for environmental initiatives
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying compliance gaps and proposing solutions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Team coordination for pollution control projects

courseDescription: Advanced study of selected topics.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective presentation of environmental data
Collaboration with multidisciplinary teams on environmental projects
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of environmental research findings

courseDescription: An opportunity is afforded students to undertake independent study under the direction of a faculty member.

courseDescription: Advanced seminar.

Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams on environmental health projects

Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and addressing occupational health issues

courseDescription: A review of the concepts and practice of administering environmental health control programs within agencies at the federal, state and local levels. The principles of administration and leadership of programs in the private sector are also discussed.  The constitutional, statutory and administrative law bases for organizing and conducting such programs and developing environmental policy as well as the legal implications of enforcement will be addressed.  A review of all major environmental statutes and their agencies that enforce them will be addressed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of major environmental statutes and agencies
Legal implications of enforcement in environmental health programs
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with stakeholders in environmental health programs
Negotiation skills in developing environmental policy
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of environmental policy effectiveness
